DataElement.preferredName: Menstrual Cycle End Reason Uterus Was Removed Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A checkbox for information related to the reason the menstrual cycle ends from the uterus removed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Menstrual Cycle End Reason Uterus Was Removed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The reason the Menstrual Cycle involving regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization ends._The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated._A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.:Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

Concepts.definition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.
Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
